intro: Diarthron antoniniae, commonly known as the Antonina's spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its succulent, glandular-stemmed structure. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, typical of the spurge family. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered in a waxy cuticle. Diarthron antoniniae is native to certain regions of South America and is adapted to grow in dry, rocky environments.
